DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm FLAIR Lesion RANO Criteria Assessment Follow-up Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The status related to the RANO assessment (an update to the MacDonald criteria for assessing disease progression and treatment response in glioblastoma multiforme (GBM)) of T2/FLAIR non-enhancing lesions sites.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm FLAIR Lesion RANO Criteria Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the RANO assessment (an update to the MacDonald criteria for assessing disease progression and treatment response in glioblastoma multiforme (GBM)) of T2/FLAIR non-enhancing lesions sites.  Fluid attenuated inversion recovery (FLAIR) is a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredName: Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Lesion Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:An update to the MacDonald criteria for assessing disease progression and treatment response in glioblastoma multiforme (GBM).:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
An update to the MacDonald criteria for assessing disease progression and treatment response in glioblastoma multiforme (GBM).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
